column4: can you pastebin your >>sudo fdisk -l << output and your >>>/boot/grub/menu.lst<< please ...
>> next time you boot, edit the command so that instead of rootnoverify (hd0,0)it's only root (hd0,0) worked for me ...
ok, i'll try editing that in grub (replace right?)
is your vista partition only ~13 GBs  ???
imo that is why its not booting .... when it was being partitioned Vista lost some importatnt files .... and thus isnt loading ...
no, i shrank the vista partition before installing ubuntu with ubuntu live (gparted)
there were no errors reported in the logs
before you installed Ubuntu .... your Vista partition was much larger i assume ????
yes, 500 GB, but only had 13 GB filled
Vistanoload .... im pretty sure that its cause Vista is corrupted .... do you have a Vista disk ...
cause what you can do is repair your Vista, then i can show you how to get your GRUB back ... xD ...
no, but there were no errors in ubuntu 9.04 gparted when resizing

gparted doesnt check to see whether the file is a system file or not before removing it, if removal is necesary ..... it happenned to me .... i attempted to make my Vista partition as small as possible and some of my files got destroyed .... .
i will download a vista cd from msdn, be right back
